Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2013 08:43AM keets858 wrote: Hello, ladies! It's been a week since my surgery and I am feeling a million times better :) I still have 6 drains in but I'm crossing my fingers that PS will take out 4 of them at my PostOp this afternoon. He will also change the dressings for the first time so it will be the first time I get to look at the new girls. I'm only taking ibuprofen during the day and Narco at night...but it's really not necessary at this point. I alternate sleeping on a rocking chair, our chaise lounge, the couch or my son's bed...depending the time of night. My butt gets so sore after sitting on it for a few hours...I can't wait to actually lie down on my side and curl up to relax. I also can't wait to get all these bandages off. You know that feeling of taking off your bra at the end of the night and it's such a relief not to feel so constricted??? Sigh...I want that feeling again. I am so constricted with the bandages and compression bra. And I really really really want to take a nice warm shower. And shave my armpits. Maybe I'll get lucky and PS will give me clearance tonight! I now have complete range of motion (although slow) with both of my arms. I can raise them both all the way up to the sky and do arm circles and shoulder shrugs. I am no longer walking like an old hunchback woman and am making a conscious effort to pull my shoulders back and walk like a lady. It is hard and tiring, but I know it's the right thing to do. My hubs yells at me because he thinks I'm doing too much...but the fact that I'm able to open our sliding glass door when last week I couldn't even touch it without wincing is a huge victory! It only gets better from here so hang in there, rest and allow your body to recover in the time it needs. Every day will get a little easier :)

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2014 07:45AM keets858 wrote: Hi, Ladies! I haven't posted here in awhile...I actually stopped coming to the discussion boards since I was feeling pretty normal.  I've had 2 rounds of chemo with hardly any SEs and my TEs are up to 320ccs (goal of 500-550).  I feel pretty darn lucky!  But I have a question for the working ladies...how long are you planning (or is the PS willing) to keep you out of work for the exchange surgery?  I took off 6 weeks for the BMX and I assumed it would be the same for the implant exchange, but I read somewhere that it's only 2 weeks!  I'm a planner...and I was trying to figure out if I would be off work for my kids spring break :)  My PS said he could do the exchange surgery 4 weeks after my last chemo treatment.   I have an open disability claim since I take off a couple of days post-chemo but I'm not sure I can keep it open long enough for my next surgery! TIA...you guys are awesome!  I'm also in my Dec 13 Chemo group but I don't feel as close to that group as this one :)

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2013 08:27PM keets858 wrote: Hello, ladies! Surgery was done and I'm home resting! So far it's not too bad. My left side feels pretty good; I can almost raise my hand all the way up in the air and to the side. My right side is in a lot more pain, due to the sentinel node biopsy. I can raise my arm though so that's a good thing. Bending down to go to the bathroom was hard for the first few times (didn't help that I started my period after surgery - can you believe my luck) but it gets better every time. They gave me Norco for pain every 3 hours but I'm taking it every 4 when I'm home; I don't think I need it that often. I have 6 drains: 3 on each side. The drains are BIG! Take a VERY baggy shirt with you for after. I brought a sleep shirt but it was too tight and it barely buttoned! Fortunately I went to the hospital in a "nice" baby doll blouse that worked perfectly. I still felt somewhat cute since it was fitted on top. Yes, I can be slightly vain ;) My doctors squeezed me in so I had a very tight surgery day, here's the timeline: check-in @ 745am, bio nuclear med injection @ 9, surgery at 1145. Lucid in recovery by 330. They didn't have a room ready so I stayed in recovery until 7 - yuck. Ate cafeteria food @ 715 - delish! Doc visited @ 630am and said I could go home anytime since I wasn't nauseous and eating well. We hung around and left @ 230. As I stated before, I have 2 & 4 year old boys who use me as a jungle gym. They've been at my mom's house all day and got home @ 5. Hubby had prepared them well and they were VERY gentle. I could see how much the little one wanted to hug me but that ain't happening for a few days! I have an appt on Thurs with the PS to change the dressings and another visit on 11/11, nothing scheduled yet with the general surgeon. I'll call him tomorrow; I want to know how many nodes he removed other than the sentinel. Ugh - I hope that helps! I'm sleepy now, but let me know if you have additional questions. Much love to all of you :)
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2013 11:09PM keets858 wrote: Hi all! I'm having a skin-sparing BMX on 11/4 - with reconstruction (TE). Chemo will start 3-4 weeks post-op then radiation. I'm 35 with a 2 and 4 year old...hoping it's not too hard on them! Very nervous but hopeful :)

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2013 03:16AM keets858 wrote: I haven't had too much pain with milking the drains...just make sure your hubs is holding the top of it before he starts to milk it so it doesn't tug on the incision! One new problem for me is that I'm having an allergic reaction to the medical tape :( My whole trunk is one giant itchy rash. I mentioned the itchiness at my PostOp today but he wasn't that concerned...a few hours later it became unbearable. I took a Claritan Hives Relief and it helped but I'll call the doc tomorrow just in case. RobinLK - you make drains look so sexy! There is no way I could make 6 drains look that good...you are too adorable :)
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2013 02:28PM keets858 wrote: allebasi - sounds like a lot of meds! Taper off if you need to...I was only sleepy the first 3 days post surgery. But I was only given Norco and took it every 3 hours; switched to Advil on day 4. I honestly haven't been in a ton of pain but my hubs thinks that's weird ;) Everyone send me good thoughts: I'm heading off to my PS and hopefully he removes all the drains so I can feel like a normal person!!!
Posts.Title: November 2013 surgeries mimi32 MCbeach

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2013 10:27AM keets858 wrote: Hey Ladies! I had my first look at the girls yesterday...WOW! It's crazy how advanced our science is and it still looks like someone hand-sewed my breasts closed - oh wait, they did! I was prepared for the image and I felt pretty good about what I saw. Doc said I'm healing well and I'll get out all six of my drains next Monday...NOT soon enough for me, but whatever :) I also got my pathology report back and they only removed the sentinel node and it had NO cancer - whew! I will still have to do chemo/radiation since it has invaded my lymphatic-vascular system. They also found ANOTHER cancer - 2cm away from the original tumor. This is a whole other cancer (DCIS) with a different pathology - how crazy is that? It just reaffirmed that I made the right decision in deciding to do a BMX, despite the fact that 2 out of 4 docs recommended a lumpectomy. The GS said yesterday that they probably wouldn't have caught it if they just did the lumpectomy. So I am super happy! gtgirl, and others who are freaking out: try not to worry so much and think positively. It sucks; we shouldn't have to be in this situation but we are :( I know things could be so much worse for me so I don't dwell on the negativity. Surround yourself with people who will listen to you and pull you up when you need help. My first son passed away when he was 3 from a genetic disorder; I thought at the time that I suffered enough with losing a child and that would be the worst thing God would throw at me. Well, I was wrong! Now I have to deal with this and I know I would rather deal with BC than deal with the pain of losing a loved one. It CAN get worse...I just hope it doesn't. Everyone is here to support you so reach out when you need help and try not to get sucked in to the internet horror stories! Sending you all strength and love!

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2013 09:31PM keets858 wrote: I had BMX on 11/4 with 6 drains. First 4 were pulled 11/18, final 2 pulled Thurs (11/20). Sat afternoon I noticed my bra (wireless, sleep-style bra) was feeling tighter. Today I realized that I'm swollen on both sides, not really in a specific area, but above the TEs and under my armpits. I can only assume its the fluid building up since I don't have drains. I don't hurt, but I just feel tight. I'm scheduled to see the PS tomorrow afternoon for my first fill. Should I be worried? So many posts on here about seromas and it doesn't seem like a big deal...but isn't a seroma a defined lump of fluid? Can I do anything to reduce the fluid? I have 2 toddlers, so it's not like I take it easy! I'm not that worried, but maybe I should be?
